title: Genny's Ballad: The Sisters, Texas Mystery Series, Book 5
features: Named
Best Mystery Series
by Association of Texas Authors
By all accounts, everyone loves Genny. So why does someone want her
dead?
There’s something special about Genesis Baker, owner of The Sister’s popular
New Beginnings Café

. With her dimpled smile and twinkling blue eyes, Genny has practically the entire town eating from the palm of her hand. But Genny is hiding a secret. Despite her sunny disposition and golden touch, there is heartache in her past, and heartache, they say, comes in threes.
Heartache Number One:
An unwelcomed customer shows up at
New Beginnings
. Apparently, the restraining order against him has lapsed.
Heartache Number Two:
Genny’s arch nemesis from high school returns to town. Twenty years has done nothing to mellow the bitter feud between these two women.
Heartache Number Three:

As Genny finally acknowledges her feelings for a younger man—sexy firefighter Cutter Montgomery—memories of her first love come back to haunt her. On top of it all, someone is stalking Genny, determined to make her life miserable.
As it turns out, being kidnapped is only the beginning of her troubles…
Great as a stand-alone cozy mystery, but Book Five of the award winning
The Sisters, Texas Mystery Series,
voted Best Mystery Series by the Texas Association of Authors, four years in a row! FREE on Kindle Unlimited.
description: I appreciate and value every review readers leave. Even though the more critical opinions are hard to read, I often learn the most from them. However, I do have one request. Before leaving a scathing review for this book, please know that the
of Chapter One was quite deliberate. Astute readers realize that each version was carefully edited to reveal details pertinent to its placement within the story. Chapter Two begins with

and begins the story there. Chapter One was more of a teaser, offering some background information for relevance that was omitted in the second telling. By contrast, Chapter Seven included details that had not yet happened at the first of the book.
Please note the differences before criticizing the editors for what you perceive as a mistake.
Thank you so much for reading, and for leaving those all-important reviews!

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/7titu50lnbapca072t3vvdcm9m._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Becki Willis', 'about': ["Best-selling indie author Becki Willis loves crafting stories with believable characters in believable situations. Many of her stories stem from her own personal experiences. (No worries; she's never actually murdered anyone).", 'When she’s not plotting danger and adventure for her imaginary friends, Becki enjoys reading, spending time with her family, unraveling a good mystery (real or imagined), dark chocolate, and a good cup of coffee. A professed history geek, Becki often weaves pieces of the past into her novels. Family is a central theme in her stories and in her life. She and her husband enjoy traveling but believe coming home to their Texas ranch is the best part of any trip.', 'Becki has won numerous awards—including two Silver Falchion Awards and a RONE, to name a few—but feels the real compliments come from her readers. Drop in for an e-visit anytime at beckiwillis.ccp@gmail.com, or www.beckiwillis.com.']}
